title: Looking for reprint Old Judge Phenomenal Smith
author: sandmountainslim

posts.post_title: Looking for reprint Old Judge Phenomenal Smith
posts.post_content:
Anyone have a reprint Phenomenal Smith card they would part with? 
Also interested in Amos Rusie.    I have done searches on ebay for both to no avail other than a eight by ten print of Smith which I'm not interested in.   I am trying to piece together a genuine T206 collection (21 of em now) but for something like Old Judge I will settle for reprints.   email me at [url]sandmountainslim@yahoo.com[/url] if ya have an extra and accept paypal.
Sorry, lads!  I posted in the wrong forum.  Thanks for moving it.

[quote name="sandmountainslim" post=955789]Sorry, lads!  I posted in the wrong forum.  Thanks for moving it.[/QUOTE]

easy mistake to make....good luck in the quest!!

.
.

No reprint Old Judge Smith's?   I am buying a "Reprint Old Judge set 1" on Ebay  ..maybe one will be in there .
This particular set

Four different sets for a seemingly reasonable price.  Hope they are halfway decent looking.

[quote name="sandmountainslim" post=957322]Wish you still had a Smith and Rusie!!  the reprints I bought don't look good as yours ;)[/QUOTE]

I have a Smith that Scott gave me many years ago. PM me your address and I will send it to you. I don't have a Rusie....regards

[quote name="Leon" post=957335]I have a Smith that Scott gave me many years ago. PM me your address and I will send it to you. I don't have a Rusie....regards[/QUOTE]
Great! What a swell guy!  PM sent :)

If any of ya do any Facebookin'  I have started a fan page for Smith 

[url]https://www.facebook.com/pages/Phenomenal-Smith/309501652426279[/url]

[quote name="sandmountainslim" post=957322]Wish you still had a Smith and Rusie!!  the reprints I bought don't look good as yours ;)[/QUOTE]

If I can find a Rusie, I will PM you and you can have it.  If nothing else, I'm sure I can re-create a reasonable one.  I don't have my materials, but should be able to come up with something.

FYI, the Smith card you link to on eBay is mis-labeled.  That is actually a card of "Pop" (Charles Marvin) Smith.  Phenomenal Smith cards are not that tough outside of his Script card portrait.  He has a total of 6 different poses in the Old Judge set.

In your research, you've probably discovered that he was a bit a troublemaker.  He was a member of four different clubs over a time span of five weeks in late 1886.  He does have an interesting history however.

[quote name="Runscott" post=957392]If I can find a Rusie, I will PM you and you can have it.  If nothing else, I'm sure I can re-create a reasonable one.  I don't have my materials, but should be able to come up with something.[/QUOTE]  
Thank U very much :)   Smith and Rusie are my favorite 19th Century players and my favorite non- T206 players

[quote name="Joe_G." post=957401]FYI, the Smith card you link to on eBay is mis-labeled.  That is actually a card of "Pop" (Charles Marvin) Smith.  Phenomenal Smith cards are not that tough outside of his Script card portrait.  He has a total of 6 different poses in the Old Judge set.

In your research, you've probably discovered that he was a bit a troublemaker.  He was a member of four different clubs over a time span of five weeks in late 1886.  He does have an interesting history however.[/QUOTE]


Yes :) Smith's personality is what makes him such an interesting part of baseball history.

Poo Poo.....I have no earthly idea why I got Smith and California Brown mixed up.... I don't have Smith. I am sorry about that. I do have a small stack of mostly HOF'ers if you are interested in any others....Anson, Keefe,Hamilton, Beckley,Griffith,Duffy, Comisky,Galvin etc.....or if you just want to see how Scott's cards came out, I will send you one. They are very nice.  Sorry about that....LL

haha.  I wasn't going to say anything, but I looked through my images and could not find a Phenomenal Smith.

I might resume that project - it was really quite a bit of fun, but I stopped because I sliced a finger to the bone and had to go to the E.R.  After that, I never created another card.

Understood :)  Yes I would be interested in seeing one of his cards, U can just pick one at random if U wish.  I have read good thngs about Scott's reprints on here.

I got the reprint set 1 from ebay which I linked to above.  Neat little cards with a player bio on the back.  No idea who reprinted them or when but I like 'em...they just need a Smith and a Rusie in the bunch.
I am damn near the point where I would take a Xerox'd Smith that I could past to cardboard :)

Ok,  Im at the bottom of the barrel :0  NO ONE has made a reprint Phenomenal Smith card as of yet,  I have figured this out by buying all the OJ reprints available on ebay and talking to people here.   

Who is willing to sell me a nice quality Xerox copy of their Smith that I can past to card stock and make my own reprint Smith with?
